title: Linear Equations: Slope-Intercept Form

vocab.definition: Linear equation written as y = mx + b
Rate of change or steepness of a line (m)
Point where line crosses the y-axis (b)
Lines with the same slope that never intersect
Lines whose slopes are negative reciprocals

teachingNotes: Emphasize graphing from slope-intercept form. Practice finding equations of parallel and perpendicular lines.

sample.question: What is the form y = mx + b called?
What is the y-intercept?
expectedAny: where it hits the y axis

sample.question: In y = 2x + 3, what is the slope?
In y = 2x + 3, what is the y-intercept?
How do you find slope from two points?
expectedAny: change in y over change in x

truefalse.question: In y = mx + b, the variable m represents the slope. (True or False)
In y = mx + b, the variable b represents the slope. (True or False)
Parallel lines have the same slope. (True or False)
Perpendicular lines have the same slope. (True or False)
The y-intercept is where the line crosses the y-axis. (True or False)
Perpendicular slopes are negative reciprocals. (True or False)
A slope of 0 is horizontal. (True or False)
A vertical line has slope 0. (True or False)
Slope-intercept form is y = mx + b. (True or False)

shortanswer.question: How do you find the slope of a line passing through points (2,3) and (4,7)?
expectedAny: Change in y over change in x: 4/2 = 2

shortanswer.question: What is the relationship between parallel lines?
What is the relationship between perpendicular lines?
expectedAny: One slope is negative reciprocal of other

shortanswer.question: How do you graph using slope-intercept form?
expectedAny: Plot y-intercept then use slope rise over run
Start at b on y-axis, use m to find next points
Plot b, then rise and run with slope

shortanswer.question: What does a positive slope mean?
expectedAny: Line goes up from left to right

shortanswer.question: What does a negative slope mean?
expectedAny: Line goes down from left to right
